programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Rangers take a 2-1 series lead into Game 4 of the Eastern Conference finals against the Panthers. Florida staged a third-period comeback in Game 3, but Alex Wennberg's first playoff goal for New York came 5:35 into overtime of a 5-4 victory.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Rangers take a 2-1 series lead into Game 4 of the Eastern Conference finals against the Panthers. Florida staged a third-period comeback in Game 3, but Alex Wennberg's first playoff goal for New York came 5:35 into overtime of a 5-4 victory.

programme.title: SportsCenter

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Rangers and Panthers return to Madison Square Garden for Game 5 of a tied Eastern Conference finals. Sam Reinhart's power-play goal gave Florida the 3-2 overtime win in Game 3 after New York prevailed in the extra frame the previous two contests.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In the summer of 1998, the St. Louis Cardinals' Mark McGwire and the Chicago Cubs' Sammy Sosa embark on a chase of one of the game's most hallowed records, igniting the passion and imagination of fans and non-fans everywhere.

programme.title: Yankees-Dodgers: An Uncivil War
programme.desc: In 1977 and 1978, the New York Yankees and Los Angeles Dodgers squared off in back-to-back World Series. This ESPN Films documentary tells the story of a rivalry filled with colorful characters, seismic controversies and unforgettable moments.

programme.title: UFC 302 Countdown: Makhachev vs. Poirier

programme.title: UFC 257: Poirier vs. McGregor
programme.desc: Marina Rodriquez vs. Amanda Ribas, women's strawweights; Andrew Sanchez vs. Makhmud Muradov, middleweights; Jessica Eye vs. Joanne Calderwood, women's flyweights; Dan Hooker vs. Michael Chandler, lightweights; Dustin Poirier vs. Conor McGregor, lightweights. From Etihad Arena in Abu Dhabi, U.A.E.

programme.title: UFC Main Events
programme.desc: UFC lightweight champion Khabib Nurmagomedov remained undefeated following a hard-fought victory against interim UFC lightweight champion, Dustin Poirier. From UFC 242 on Sept. 7, 2019.

programme.desc: Through interviews with Isiah Thomas, Bill Laimbeer, Joe Dumars, Dennis Rodman, Adrian Dantley, Mark Aguirre and others, viewers are provided an inside look at what made the Detroit Pistons, of the late 80's and early 90's, tick.

programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: The Mina Kimes Show Featuring Lenny
programme.desc: Mina Kimes combines intense film study with sharp data analysis, plus her trademark humor and insight. She's joined each episode by a guest from around the league.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.desc: The Panthers (6-2) continue to tune up for the USFL Conference title game by visiting the Roughnecks (1-7) for a Week 9 matchup. Michigan will square off against Birmingham on June 8 for the opportunity to play for the first UFL championship.

programme.desc: The Showboats (1-7) and Defenders (3-5) play out the string as they meet in Week 9. D.C.'s playoff hopes in the XFL Conference were officially dashed by a 26-21 loss at St. Louis in Week 8. Memphis looks to avoid the basement of the USFL Conference.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: The Timbers (4-7-4) go up against Austin FC (6-4-5). Portland stands alongside San Jose as the only MLS sides yet to register a clean sheet in 2024. On the flip side, Austin's Brad Stuver is tied for second in the league with five clean sheets.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Top West squads meet as LAFC host Minnesota United FC. Los Angeles (7-4-3) came out of the break with a 1-0 road victory over Atlanta to move within a point of Minnesota (7-2-4). The Loons snapped a seven-game winless run versus LAFC on March 16.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Racing's longest day resumes with the NASCAR Cup Series' longest race, the Coca-Cola 600. Kyle Larson is the first driver to attempt Double Duty, competing in both the Indianapolis 500 and Coca-Cola 600 in the same day, since Kurt Busch in 2014.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: Following NASCAR's All-Star weekend festivities, the Xfinity Series returns to action with the BetMGM 300 at Charlotte Motor Speedway. Justin Allgaier, an Xfinity veteran of nearly 15 seasons, picked up his first win of 2024 at Darlington on May 11.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series stays in the Tar Heel State for the North Carolina Education Lottery 200. Last week, 21-year-old Corey Heim collected his series-leading third checkered flag of the season at North Wilkesboro Speedway.

programme.title: Shirley
programme.desc: Shirley is the real story of the inimitable Shirley Muldowney. Salty, sassy, unflappable - Shirley crushed stereotypes and became an integral part of the gritty, golden age of drag racing. Her aggressive approach fueled intense rivalries, passionate fan reactions, and sometimes caustic headlines but never derailed her quest to be a champion.

programme.desc: Rookie guard Caitlin Clark and the Fever host the Sparks. Clark averages 15.4 points, 6.3 assists and 5.4 rebounds per game. Indiana is 1-6 following a 99-80 loss at Las Vegas. The Fever's win came against the Sparks in Los Angeles 78-73 on May 24.

programme.desc: Rookie guard Caitlin Clark and the Fever host the Sparks. Clark averages 15.4 points, 6.3 assists and 5.4 rebounds per game. Indiana is 1-6 following a 99-80 loss at Las Vegas. The Fever's win came against the Sparks in Los Angeles 78-73 on May 24.

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.
